results.title: Tati shorts
results.brief_description: The characters in these three short films will be familiar territory to fans of actor/director Jacques Tati. “Soigne ton Gauche=Watch your Left” (12 mins. 1936) directed by Rene Clement, focuses on a boxer whose training suffers considerable upheaval when he is joined in the ring by Tati bearing many traits of what would later become the Hulot character. This film has some French dialogue but the soundtrack is ambient rather than specific. “L’Ecole des Facteurs=School for Postmen” (15 mins. 1947) sees Tati approach his studies in a confused and enthusiastic manner. This character would go on to reap global fame as Francois the Postman in ‘Jour de Fete’. In “Cours du Soir=Evening Classes” (28 mins. 1967) Tati’s portrayal of a teacher presents an amalgam of Hulot and Francois allowing both characters full comic reign in the classroom.

results.title: Taste
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Lisa Dombroski
results.brief_description: An energetic short romantic comedy, with a transsexual twist. As Suz’s relationship with her rock musician boyfriend, who is also the father of her young son, grinds to an end, she becomes attracted to Danny, the chef at the restaurant where she works. Danny is the antithesis of her insensitive boyfriend and seduces her with food and humour. Yet thrill and excitement of discovering new love, is temporarily dampened by the emotional confusion Suz experiences when she discovers that Danny was once a woman. Cast includes Kate Oliver, Peter Barron, Sullivan Stapleton and Billy Havir-Smith.

results.title: Tasmanian wild life
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian State Film Unit and Don Anderson
results.brief_description: Tasmania’s characteristic rough mountainous terrain serves as a sanctuary for preserving its natural wildlife. Features the Tasmanian devil and Tasmanian tiger.

results.title: Tasmanian tapestry
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Maslyn Williams and Hugh McInnes
results.brief_description: Shows some of the highlights of Tasmania’s scenery. Pictures the many threads which combine to form the tapestry of life in the State of Tasmania - a pattern composed of high, snowcapped mountains, lakes, fast streams, hop fields, orchards, towns and cities rich in colonial history: of fast developing secondary industries, great mineral resources and expanding hydro-electric schemes.

results.title: Tasmanian adventure
results.brief_description: A tour of the scenic highlights of Tasmania, showing the variety of scenery, and the many sports available to the visitor. Shows beaches, rivers, rainforests, and rugged mountains where people can swim, sail, fish, surf and ski.
